messages.subject: Re: Fanart from japan
messages.msgSnippet: Oh yes, it seems that Saitou is almost like a babysitter for our little Toshihime (the wife of Matsudaira Katamori)!!! (^_^) Yes, Hirotada Tokugawa showed me
messages.messageBody:
Oh yes, it seems that Saitou is almost like a babysitter for our
little Toshihime (the wife of Matsudaira Katamori)!!! (^_^)

Yes, Hirotada Tokugawa showed me that fanart with Yaso a while
back---sometimes it is hard for us to grab links or remember the
addresses---in my case if I am on Japanese websites using
http://www.nifty.com/globalgate it prevents me from seeing the domain.

MOre Saitou Tokio pics

http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/146146.jpg

http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/120001.jpg

http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/39999.jpg

this looks funny (has Saitou in it too)
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/45000.jpg

I love Yamakawa Ookura/Taizo/Hiroshi and his brother Kenjiro!
Oh but they are missing the trusty and bright page of Matsudaira
Katamori, Takamine Tadayoshi (Hideo) (T_T)

--- In SHQ_Spy_Division@yahoogroups.com, Mio Yamada
<purplealienmio@...> wrote:
There

> The theme is "Tonami-han" and the caption for Saitou

> Also, Yamakawa is depicted here as Ookura. And there

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ_Spy_Division] Fanart from japan
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Sec, I ve loved this site for so long - I was convinced that you guys already knew about it! So I d be happy to answer some of the questions. Saitou is
messages.messageBody:
Dear Sec,

I've loved this site for so long - I was convinced
that you guys already knew about it! So I'd be happy
to answer some of the questions.

Saitou is not necessarily PMK influenced - although
his hairstyle seems like it is. However, Saitou in
this fan-universe is portrayed as a retainer of Aizu
(Yamaguchi Hajime) who is sent to work for the
Shinsengumi as an insider.

The site is very much a Toshihime-Katamori 'ship, as
well as Saitou-Tokio and Yamanami-Akesato. So, the
pics of Saitou with a woman are Saitou-Tokio. There
are a few where he is messing with Toshihime, and only
one where it's implied that the woman is Yaso:
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/35555.jpg
The theme is "Tonami-han" and the caption for Saitou
reads "the mysterious local wife", which might not
make any sense but "genchi-zuma (local wife)" is not
exactly a word with positive connotations.
There are a few others with the Joushitai - but my
personal favourites are the ones of Teru Hime and
Tokio.
Also, Yamakawa is depicted here as Ookura. And there
are a few with his younger brother too.

I seriously thought that everyone else knew about this
site already - I'd be happy to try and translate some
of the comic strips and the character descriptions. It
really, really cracks me up.

But I must get back to work now - hope I helped answer
some of the questions.

Best wishes,

Mio.

messages.subject: Fanart from japan
messages.msgSnippet: This page is actually a fan page for Matsudaira Katamori (daimyo of Aizu and boss of the Shinsengumi) http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/top.html so basically there are
messages.messageBody:
This page is actually a fan page for Matsudaira Katamori (daimyo of
Aizu and "boss" of the Shinsengumi) http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/top.html

so basically there are alot of "crossover" universes in fandom and
this page is 100% original art however Saitou is clearly PMK
influenced

SUPER PIC...look carefully for the Shinsengumi and the AIZU
JOUSHITAI women's Brigade
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/pos3.jpg


Many members of the Shinsengumi are drawn here in his/her chara
profile
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/gumi-06.gif

Hijikata and Saitou
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/14000.jpg

Saitou
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/gumi-06.gif
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/hon12.gif

seems to be Saitou and Sada/tokio or ::gasp:: is this a rare fanart
of SHinoda Yaso his first wife? (I cannot tell)
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/16879.jpg
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/146146.jpg

well you ought to see this one
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/111111.jpg
and
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/135351.jpg

Hijikata and Yamakawa Hiroshi (I think---using one of his other
names? Taizo or Ookura perhaps---I'm not sure)
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/34222.jpg
there are several fanarts from Japan which make the comparison
between the Shinsengumi Oni vice chief with Aizu's famed young
military leader
both men could think on their feet and had alot of charisma---Y.
Hiroshi however was not as good looking as Hijikata. Hiroshi did
not die in the Boshin war and lived well into the Meiji Era to match
Fujita Goro and Tokio.

Aizu Fangirl moment.....
Yamakawa Hiroshi well known for the ploy to enter Aizu castle using
the lion dance
http://gasi2dou.moo.jp/10777.jpg
